term.title: homo

item.text: An acronym for Highest Occupied Molecular Orbital (HOMO).
A prefix (consisting of lower case letters, homo), used to indicate a higher homologue of a compound.

sources.item: PAC, 1994, 66, 1077. 'Glossary of terms used in physical organic chemistry (IUPAC Recommendations 1994)' on page 1121 (https://doi.org/10.1351/pac199466051077)

item.text: homo- Affix used to denote a ring expansion by inclusion of a methylene group into a ring-sector.

term.citation: Citation: 'homo' in IUPAC Compendium of Chemical Terminology, 5th ed. International Union of Pure and Applied Chemistry; 2025. Online version 5.0.0, 2025. 10.1351/goldbook.H02838

Users of these terms are encouraged to include the version of a term with its use and to check regularly for updates to term definitions that you are using.
